Caption: Fig. 1. Space-scale diagrams illustrating two experimental comparisons of zooming interfaces with display size varied between D and 2D: (a) Constant information space (of size 2I) is used for both display size conditions (left and middle diagram); scale ratio S/S’ varies between display sizes. (b) Variable information space (2I vs. I) is used for the display size conditions (middle and right diagram); scale ratio S/S’ is constant across display size conditions.

Fig. 2. Illustration of the three interfaces used in the experiments. S = 1 is the scale that shows the information space at the highest level of detail. S’ is the scale used for showing the entire information space and is the lowest scale used in the interface.

Fig. 4. Average completion times for different task types with focus+context (F+C), overview+detail (O+D), and zooming (Z+P) at different display sizes for the variable-information-space experiment. Error bars show standard error of the mean.

Fig. 5. Average completion times with focus+context (F+C), overview+detail (O+D), and zooming (Z+P) for tasks with equal target distance across display sizes in the variable-information-space experiment. Error bars show standard error of the mean.

Fig. 4. Average completion times for different task types with focus+context (F+C), overview+detail (O+D), and zooming (Z+P) at different display sizes for the variable-information-space experiment. Error bars show standard error of the mean.

Fig. 6. Average ratings of subjective mental effort (SMEQ) with North [31] reported higher subjective workload for a 32-megapixel focus+context (F+C), overview+detail (O+D), and zooming (Z+P) at display than for a 2-megapixel display, but data size was varied different display sizes for the two experiments. Higher rating indicates relative to display size in that study and the difference in workload higher effort. Error bars show standard error of the mean. scores could in part be explained by a difference in task difficulty.

Fig. 8. Average mouse distance traveled (pixels) in view navigation (a- c) and target selection (d-f) phases of Navigate tasks. Note that the y- scales cover different ranges.
Fig. 7. Average time spent (seconds) in Navigate tasks in total (a-c), for search (d-f), for view navigation (g-i), and for target selection (j-l).
